result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcarious S Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber for school and after school football weight training at Horlick High School.  Do not report to the jail late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcarious S Scott

Defendant Marcarious S Scott in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Marcarious S Scott in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin. ZCI report.
Preliminary hearing at 11-18-2015 09:00 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Marcarious S Scott in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Marcarious S Scott in custody.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
